Steps.Message: We became aware of this power cut at 08:16. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut, but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly. Engineers in our control room have switched some customers power back on in your area. To get everyone’s power back on we may need to attend to investigate and make repairs. We’ll continue to update you until everyone’s power is back on.
Steps.Name: We are restoring customers automatically

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of our equipment in your area. This has identified 24 electricity poles that need replacing and upgrading. We will also be replacing a piece of equipment called a transformer at the same time. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our contractors Avidety may carry out preparation works prior to the power cut. During this time, you will be connected to a generator to provide you with electricity whilst we carry out the works. To connect the generator we will need to switch off your power temporarily. This work is taking place near Grafham Road. Temporary traffic lights will be in place to allow the work to be carried out safely. Access to your property will always be provided.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We are needing to replace a piece of our electrical equipment due to it coming to the end of its serviceable life. This equipment is known as a linkbox and is essential equipment where our cables connect underground. To ensure our engineers can carry out these works safely we will need to temporarily switch off your power. Once work is completed this will ensure our electricity network is working to the best of its ability and also reduce the possibility of having an unplanned power cut. This work is taking place on Church Hill. Please note 3 way traffic management will be in place on the day for the works to be completed safely.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: To provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, we carry out regular inspections of trees near our overhead cables. This has identified trees that have grown close to 7 spans of electricity cables, which could damage the cables and affect your electricity supply. Our engineers need to temporarily switch off your power so we can safely cut the trees away from the cables. Doing this will reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future as we appreciate your area has been impacted with unplanned power cuts in the last 6 months. This work is taking place in multiple locations near Gedding Road, Cross Street and Rattlesden Road.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: We regularly inspect our electrical equipment to ensure it is safe and efficient. We need to examine a transformer on our electricity poles to check it is functioning properly. This essential work helps to provide a reliable electricity supply to your property, reducing the risk of any unplanned power cuts in the future. To keep everyone safe while we carry out these works, we will need to temporarily turn off your electricity. We are taking extra measures to limit the time your power is off and we'll do our best to cause as little disruption as possible. Doing this will improve the reliability of the electricity network in the future. This work is taking place near Swallow Lane.

Steps.Message: Good morning, this is a message from Ryan at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut which is currently in progress today the 4th of November 2025 in the CB21 postcode area. Our contractors have advised us that the 44 affected properties will be restored early between approximately 10:00-10:15 as the works have progressed well. We can confirm that once power has been restored to the area that the works to inspect a transformer near Fulbourn Old Drift will be completed which will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of you having an unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work is INCD-23417-O. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you a 10/10 service then please call us on 105.

IncidentCategoryCustomerFriendlyDescript: Good afternoon, this is a message from Brooke at UK Power Networks regarding the planned power cut currently in progress today the 04/11/2025 in the PE37 postcode area. The power was switched off at 09:12 to enable our engineers to remove ivy from a low voltage pole near Ketts Hill. Our engineers have advised us that the 20 affected properties will be restored early at 12:30. This is because works have progressed better than expected. Now that these works have been completed this will improve the reliability of the network and reduce the risk of unplanned power cut in the future. Our reference number for this work was INCD-15225-I. I hope that the power coming on earlier is of benefit to you. We always aim to provide a 10/10 service, if you feel we have not delivered you that service then please call us on 105.

Steps.Message:
Sent by David at 22:48 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repaired our equipment in the Cale Street area. We have now restored power to the majority of the area however we are unable to restore power to Hammerfield House as yet.
 
Our engineers have been working hard to get you back on, but due to private equipment inside the building suffering water damage, we are awaiting for internal repairs to be completed before we can restore power inside Hammerfield House. This means we will not have any updates on this at this stage.
 
If you are not inside the affected building and your power is still off, or you do have any concerns, please contact our team free on 105. They are available 24 hours a day.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, this is David - I wanted to let you know I have just taken over for the night shift, so I'll be here until tomorrow morning making sure you have the latest news from our staff.

I know that power being off may be especially worrying for you as we head later into the evening, but our field teams work 24 hours so I'll let know further news as soon as it comes in.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 20:24 - Our engineers are still on site working on repairs. We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them. For more information, please see your terms of connection, which are usually provided by your supplier but are available here https://bit.ly/3KDEEF2. Thank you.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Lisa at 17:06 - Hello again. Thanks for bearing with us during the power cut, I know the lights being off is a worry.

Our staff have advised that it is taking longer than expected for our specialist's to arrive on site to assist with the repairs on the overhead network. . Due to the delay this has caused, they've advised a new time of 22:30 and 23:30 to have your power back on.

I know another delay is frustrating; our engineers always try to give us the best estimate that they can but due to the safety elements of working with live electricity, sometimes they have to adjust their repairs at short notice.

I'm sorry if this has caused you to change any plans you've made, but we'll be here to update you until the lights are safely back on.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us we require further staff on site to assist with repairs to our overhead network.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 20:00 and 21:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Lisa at 16:09.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 16:44 - We are sorry to have to let you know that it's going to take us a little longer than we expected to get all the power back on in the area. Our engineers have advised us that they have located the fault however, they firstly need to move a few cars which are parked on top of the fault so they can safely excavate and expose the fault for repairs.

Therefore, we're now aiming to restore supplies between 22:00 and 23:00. We're sorry we've had to change the estimated time, but we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Roland at 16:36 - Our engineers have investigated and found that the power is off due to a fault on our underground electricity network which has affected our substation equipment. They have successfully been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We have further specialist teams and equipment on site and it's possible they will still be able to restore your power within the current time frame using other methods. However, once they've assessed further we'll let you know if the time frame needs to change. We'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

We have been alerted to a potentially dangerous situation involving a grounded overhead cable, so have responded as quickly as possible and asked our control room to turn power off to the area using our high voltage network. This is why a wide area has lost electricity.

Once further specialist field staff have assessed the situation, we'll start diverting power back to affected homes as soon as they advise us it's safe. You may notice your lights going on and off as we work to get as much power restored as we can.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 16:29 - We're very sorry we've had to switch off your electricity. Our engineers have turned off the power in the Cambridge CB25 area in the interest of the public's health and safety. This is so they can investigate reports of an overhead cable that is on the ground.

If in the area, please take care and stay at least 10m away from the cable. 

Until our engineers arrive on site and investigate, it's difficult to advise you a time frame. However, based on an average for this kind of issue, our estimated time to have you back on is between 17:30 and 18:30. 

We'll keep you updated with our progress, but in the meantime our team are always here to talk on 105 if you have any questions or concerns.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 10:01 - We can now confirm that all power in the Union Street area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault with some of our network equipment, which our engineers have now replaced.

We know that being without power can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Will at 09:05 - Thanks for bearing with us today.

Our engineers are checking our substation equipment to ensure our network is healthy before they attempt to restore your power. They may also walk our cabling route throughout the area to check for any visible problems, check smaller electrical sites in the area, or apply specialist equipment which may restore power temporarily to help them with their testing.

We know that our customers may be worried about the food in the fridge and freezer, so we want to try and help with advice. Food should keep for up to 4 hours in the fridge, and between 24-48 hours in the freezer if you avoid opening them.

We'll keep you updated on our engineers progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Our engineers have arrived on site in the Union Street area, the estimated time of 13:00 and 14:00 hasn't changed. We know that a power cut can be very disruptive; we understand this can greatly impact your daily activities and we want to support you however we can. We'll update you with all of our progress, but if you need to speak to us, call our team on 08003163105 any time. If you would like more information about what we think the fault is; here's a short YouTube video https://bit.ly/2y8Dtfz. Sent by Will at 08:55.

Steps.Message:
Sent by Decasta at 10:09 - I'm texting to say I am glad to report that power to the Harrington Square NW1 2 area should now be back on.

Following thorough tests at our substation and on local network equipment, our staff have been able to safely replace our network equipment. The suspected underground cabling issue is not yet appearing on any of our tests, so for the moment we have restored your power as quickly as possible.

I'm afraid this may happen again, but every time you lose power it gives us a better chance of pinpointing the problem. I'm sorry for the continued disruption, but If you'd like to talk to us about this, or if your power isn't on call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
I appreciate your continued patience this morning. We want to be as transparent as possible as we know having multiple power cuts is disruptive and worrying, so I would like to help explain why we can't always fix a problem like this right away.

Underground electricity cabling is insulated for safety and if a fault develops, these materials can re-seal due to heat passing through them when our safety equipment operates and your power is lost. This covers any potential fault again, meaning our staff cannot locate it using their tests or specialist equipment.

We'll know more once our staff contact us again, so I'll be in touch again shortly.

Sent by Decasta at 09:48.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our staff are on site in the Harrington Square NW1 2 area. Due to there being multiple power cuts over a short space of time, our engineers are going to start their tests at the nearby substation.

Our current time frame is between 12:30-13:30; this is an estimate based on them checking the state of our network, and attempting to restore your power.

It's possible that the underground cabling fault we believe has been causing these power cuts has reach a point where they can't safely replace our substation equipment. If this happens we'll need to arrange further teams and equipment, so I'll let you know more news as soon as our staff update us. Sent by Decasta at 09:18.

We're doing this work as it's essential to provide reliable electricity supplies to your area. We're sorry for any inconvenience caused and thank you for your patience.
MainMessage: We have repaired the problem with the electricity supply in your area. There may still be some tidying up to do, and any details have been passed to our Maintenance department, who will attend to it as soon as possible. Please accept our sincere apologies for any inconvenience this may cause.

Steps.Message: We became aware of a power cut at 12:15. We’re sorry for any disruption this may have caused you. We didn’t know in advance there would be a power cut but now that we know, our teams will do everything they can to get your power back quickly.
Steps.Name: Reported

Steps.Message: We have engineers on their way. As this is affecting your area, they will not need to attend your property. Rest assured once they arrive, they’ll work as quickly as is safely possible to get your power back on.
Steps.Name: Engineers on their way

Steps.Message: Engineers are now on site, carrying out investigations into the fault. Once they have completed their assessment, they will carry out repairs.
Steps.Name: Investigating & fixing

Steps.Message: All power in the area should be back on. We’re really sorry for any disruption this caused.
Steps.Name: Power back on

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 16:48 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Snoots Road area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground cables, which our engineers have now repaired.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 15:46 - We are sorry to have to let you know that it's going to take us a little longer than we expected to get all the power back on in the area. This is to allow time for our engineers to safely excavate and expose the faulty underground cable for repairs.

Therefore, we're now aiming to restore supplies between 17:30 and 18:30. We're sorry we've had to change the estimated time, but we'll keep you updated.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Sent by Theo at 05:33 - Thank you for your patience while our engineers repaired a fault on the underground network in the Hillbrook Road area. We have now restored power to all but one property. We're sorry for any disruption this unexpected power cut caused.

If your power isn't back on, we'd still like to keep you updated. If we aren't currently in contact with you by phone or in person at your property, please call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.

Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message: Sent by Theo at 04:31 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers. We know your power may now be back on, however; we'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Our engineers have just called in to advise us that our digging team are progressing well with excavations to expose our cabling so repairs can begin.

Unfortunately, it's going to take us past our current time frame to complete this safely, so we're now working towards between 05:00 and 06:00 to have power back on.

We can appreciate how frustrating and disruptive being without power can be, and our staff are working as fast as they can. If you have any questions or concerns, please feel free to speak to our team, but I'll let you know further news as it comes in from site. Sent by Theo at 02:38.

We know that being without power for a long time can be especially difficult, so we're sorry for the outage. Please rest assured our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

Our team of specialist engineers have arrived on site to locate and fix the underground cable fault.

At the moment we don't need to change our estimated time frame, and we'll continue to keep you updated with all of our progress as it comes in from site. Sent by Talie at 12:17.

Sent by Talie at 12:08 - Our engineers have been able to divert electricity around the faulty part of the network, restoring power to some customers.

We know your power may now be back on, however; we'll keep sending text updates to everyone until all the power to your area is on. To stop receiving texts, just follow this link https://bit.ly/348KOZ3 to unsubscribe.

PlannedIncidentReason: We're carrying out planned work in your area. For our engineers to carry it out safely they need to turn the power off. Steps.Message:
Sent by Roland at 16:46 - I'm pleased to confirm that all power in the Carlton Avenue area should be back on. The issue was caused by an unexpected fault on our underground cables, which our engineers have diverted power around the fault.

We know that a power cut can be difficult, and I'm sorry for the length of the time you were without your electricity. Please rest assured that our staff will continue to work around the clock to keep the lights on.

If your power isn't on or there's anything you'd like to talk to us about, call us on 08003163105 which is free from landlines and mobiles.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
Hi, it's Roland from the messaging team at UK Power Networks. I understand how difficult it can be without power and the additional worries this can bring.

For both our business customers and those at home, we will work as quickly and safely as possible to restore supplies. If you need any additional support or have any concerns, please call us on 105 or tweet us @ukpowernetworks.

I will personally continue to keep you updated with our progress.
Steps.Name: Customer Service Team

Steps.Message:
What will happen next?

This outage is affecting multiple areas, so locations we mention may be further away than you'd expect. We have already sent staff to the area, but at the same time we try to restore power remotely by redirecting the electricity around the faulty section. It's possible your power may go on and off as we try to restore as much power as we can.

The engineer will head to the local substation and after checking the network, will attempt to restore more power from there. If unsuccessful, they will locate and repair the issue, which will take longer to get the lights on.

Our staff work as quickly as they can, so you might not hear about everything we're doing, but we'll always try to give you the clearest information we have.
